definition: to sing to a string accompaniment/education (a reference to teaching the people Confucian values by means of song in ancient times)
bow string/string of musical instrument/watchspring/chord (segment of curve)/hypotenuse/CL:根[gen1]
reed-pipe wind instrument and vertical bamboo flute
qin and se, two string instruments that play in perfect harmony/marital harmony
xiao, a Chinese musical instrument of ancient times, similar to panpipes
deep and somber/see also 窈窈[yao3 yao3]
to play the zither/classical variant of 彈琴|弹琴[tan2 qin2]
guzheng or long zither/long zither with 13 to 16 strings, developed from guqin 古琴 during Tang and Song times/Japanese koto
your kind offer/your valued advice/delicate interest and charm
to chant/to recite/to moan/to groan/cry (of certain animals and insects)/song (ancient poem)
(particle in old Chinese similar to 啊)
